genres.name: Classical
genres.description: Formal musical tradition with complex orchestral arrangements and sophisticated harmonic structures.

artists.name: Ludwig van Beethoven
artists.bio: Revolutionary composer who bridged Classical and Romantic periods, known for symphonies that expressed profound emotion.

artists.name: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
artists.bio: Prolific and influential composer of the Classical period, known for his mastery of every genre.

instruments.name: Piano
instruments.description: Versatile keyboard instrument capable of both melody and harmony

instruments.name: Violin
instruments.description: String instrument known for its expressive and virtuosic capabilities

instruments.name: Cello
instruments.description: Deep-toned string instrument that forms the bass foundation

genres.name: Jazz
genres.description: Genre characterized by improvisation, syncopation, and complex harmonies with African American roots.

artists.name: Miles Davis
artists.bio: Innovative trumpeter and bandleader who constantly evolved his style across multiple jazz subgenres.

artists.name: John Coltrane
artists.bio: Saxophone virtuoso known for his spiritual approach to music and technical innovations.

instruments.name: Saxophone
instruments.description: Versatile woodwind instrument central to jazz expression

instruments.name: Trumpet
instruments.description: Bright brass instrument perfect for jazz improvisation

instruments.name: Double Bass
instruments.description: Foundation instrument providing rhythmic and harmonic support

genres.name: Rock
genres.description: Energetic genre built around electric guitars, strong rhythm section, and powerful vocals.

artists.name: The Beatles
artists.bio: Revolutionary band that transformed popular music and culture in the 1960s.

artists.name: Led Zeppelin
artists.bio: Heavy rock pioneers known for powerful vocals, guitar riffs, and epic compositions.

instruments.name: Electric Guitar
instruments.description: Core instrument of rock music, capable of distortion and effects

instruments.name: Drums
instruments.description: Percussion foundation driving the rock rhythm

genres.name: Electronic
genres.description: Music created using electronic devices, synthesizers, and computer technology.

artists.name: Kraftwerk
artists.bio: Pioneers of electronic music who influenced countless artists across multiple genres.

artists.name: Aphex Twin
artists.bio: Innovative electronic artist known for complex rhythms and experimental soundscapes.

instruments.name: Synthesizer
instruments.description: Electronic instrument capable of generating various sounds

instruments.name: Drum Machine
instruments.description: Electronic device for creating percussion patterns

instruments.name: Sampler
instruments.description: Device for recording and manipulating audio samples

genres.name: Folk
genres.description: Traditional music passed down through generations, often featuring acoustic instruments and storytelling.

artists.name: Bob Dylan
artists.bio: Influential singer-songwriter who brought literary depth to popular music.

artists.name: Joni Mitchell
artists.bio: Poetic songwriter known for her unique guitar tunings and introspective lyrics.

instruments.name: Acoustic Guitar
instruments.description: Traditional string instrument perfect for folk melodies

instruments.name: Harmonica
instruments.description: Portable wind instrument common in folk music

instruments.name: Banjo
instruments.description: String instrument with distinctive bright, percussive sound

genres.name: World Music
genres.description: Traditional and contemporary music from cultures around the world, showcasing diverse musical traditions.

artists.name: Ravi Shankar
artists.bio: Master of the sitar who introduced Indian classical music to the Western world.

artists.name: Youssou N'Dour
artists.bio: Senegalese singer known for his powerful voice and fusion of traditional and modern sounds.

instruments.name: Sitar
instruments.description: Indian string instrument with sympathetic strings

instruments.name: Djembe
instruments.description: West African hand drum with deep, resonant sound

instruments.name: Didgeridoo
instruments.description: Aboriginal Australian wind instrument with unique sound
